alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 4:14PM MST until August 14 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwest Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 715 PM MST. * At 412 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in northwest Coconino County from Fredonia east to Marble Canyon and Lees Ferry. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Marble Canyon, Lees Ferry, Grand Canyon National Park, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 537 and 541...and between mile markers 596 and 608. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Kaibab Wash, Fall Creek, Johnson Wash, Coyote Wash, Paria River, White Sage Wash, Rock Canyon, Johnson Run, Wildcat Canyon, House Rock Wash, Jacob Canyon and Badger Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Enhanced risk for violent, life-threatening flash flooding in slot canyons and normally dry washes.Flash floods can come from distant thunderstorms, even with little or no rainfall in the immediate area.
